4.3.1.title: Formation Pressure
4.3.1.content:
**From SIDPP:**
```
Formation Pressure = SIDPP + Hydrostatic Pressure (drillstring)
```

**Example:**
SIDPP = 520 psi
MW = 10.5 ppg
TVD = 10,000 ft

HP = 10.5 × 0.052 × 10,000 = 5,460 psi
Formation Pressure = 520 + 5,460 = 5,980 psi

4.3.2.title: Influx Gradient
4.3.2.content:
**To determine influx type:**
```
Influx Gradient = Mud Gradient - [(SICP - SIDPP) ÷ Influx Height]
```

**Influx Height:**
```
Influx Height (ft) = Pit Gain (bbl) ÷ Annular Capacity (bbl/ft)
```

**Example:**
SIDPP = 520 psi
SICP = 680 psi
Pit Gain = 20 bbl
Annular Capacity = 0.05 bbl/ft
MW = 10.5 ppg

Influx Height = 20 ÷ 0.05 = 400 ft
Mud Gradient = 10.5 × 0.052 = 0.546 psi/ft

Influx Gradient = 0.546 - [(680-520) ÷ 400]
Influx Gradient = 0.546 - 0.4 = 0.146 psi/ft

**Interpretation:**
- < 0.15 psi/ft: Gas
- 0.15 - 0.35 psi/ft: Gas/oil mix
- 0.35 - 0.45 psi/ft: Oil or condensate
- > 0.45 psi/ft: Salt water

4.3.3.title: Kick Tolerance
4.3.3.content:
**Definition:**
Maximum kick size that can be safely circulated out without exceeding MAASP.

**Simplified Formula (gas kick):**
```
Kick Tolerance (bbl) = MAASP ÷ [(MW gradient - Gas gradient) × Annular cap]
```

**Factors Affecting Kick Tolerance:**
- Higher MAASP → Higher tolerance
- Heavier mud → Higher tolerance
- Larger annulus → Higher tolerance
- Longer open hole → Lower tolerance
- Gas vs liquid kick → Gas is worse

**Use:**
- Plan operations within kick tolerance
- Tighter margins require more vigilance
- HPHT wells often have very low kick tolerance

4.3.4.title: Gas Migration Rate
4.3.4.content:
**Estimating Rate:**
Gas rises through static mud at approximately:
- Light mud (9-10 ppg): 1,000-2,000 ft/hr
- Medium mud (11-13 ppg): 500-1,000 ft/hr
- Heavy mud (14+ ppg): 300-500 ft/hr

**Pressure Increase:**
```
Pressure increase per hour = Migration rate × Mud gradient
```

**Example:**
Mud weight = 12 ppg (gradient = 0.624 psi/ft)
Estimated migration = 700 ft/hr

Pressure increase = 700 × 0.624 = 437 psi/hr

**Implication:**
If shut-in with gas below, surface pressure increases. May need volumetric method.

4.3.5.title: Annular Capacity
4.3.5.content:
**Formula:**
```
Annular Capacity (bbl/ft) = (Hole ID² - Pipe OD²) ÷ 1029.4
```

**Common Capacities:**
| Hole | Pipe | Capacity |
|------|------|----------|
| 12.25" | 5" DP | 0.1215 bbl/ft |
| 8.5" | 5" DP | 0.0459 bbl/ft |
| 8.5" | 6.5" DC | 0.0291 bbl/ft |

**Use:**
- Calculate influx height
- Determine volumes at various depths
- Kill circulation planning
